p.s: The sonnet is buildbuilt in three quartrainsquatrains and one couplet.
The metrum is the iambic pentameter and the rhyme is ABABCDCDEFEFGG.
The first quartrainsquatrains deals with the alteration of love.
He compares the love as wandering bark (l .7), or a never shaken tempest (vgl. l. 6).
This shows that the love always changechanges and it's never be the same.
He also describedescribes it as an ever-fixed mark (vgl. l. 5).
In one sentence the poet says that you can bend the love with the remover to remove (l. 4).
I think it should say that you have aan influence on you emotions and feelings.
But the next sentence says the opposite.
How I metioned earlier in my analyses is the love described as ever-fixed mark.
This has the effect that if you have to do with love, there is always a hurt, but every time in a different way.
To describe the love, the poet personificated objects.
Love has not only bad sides.
She is not a time fool, so if you love someone you get rosy lips and cheeks (l. 9).
There is a personification in line 7.
The star to every wandring bark stands for a person, where you in love with, and this person leadleads you in you feelings.
In one couplet (ll. 13-14) the poet realises that if it be an error that he never have written and never loved the man.
